seg.seg: (Das Jaṭila-Gewand) ... verschwand ihnen, und nur Kaṣāyagewänder wurden an ihrem Körper gesehen.
(The Jaṭila-garb) ... disappeared from them, and only Kaṣāya-garments were seen on their body.
Ihr [herbei] gekommenen Mönche, übet Sittlichkeit!
Ye monks [that have] come [here], observe morality!
If you, our help[er]s,
If you, our help[er]s, recognise Mahāśramaṇa as your teacher [and] break [lit. give up] your own vow, why should we be amazed? (cf 394)
Wenn ihr, unser Beistand [im Toch. Plural] den Mahāśramaṇa als euren Lehrer anerkennt [und] euer eigenes Gelübde aufgebt, was sollten [wtl. sind] wir [da] verwundert sein?
If you, our helper[s], acknowledge Mahāśramaṇa as your master [and] give up your own vow, why should [lit. are] we be amazed?
recognise Mahāśramaṇa as your teacher [and] break [lit. give up] your own vow, why should we be amazed? ... Whoever may be praised by you as refuge, to which doctrine you bind yourself, to that
Whoever may be praised by you as refuge, to which doctrine you bind yourself, to that we bind ourselves too.
we bind ourselves too.

Darauf machten sich die zwei verbrüderten Kāśyapas zusammen mit [ihren] Schülern auf, [und] zum Buddha, dem Lehrer, gekommen, sprachen sie: "O Mahāśramaṇa! Zusammen (mit) dem Gefolge von diesen sind wir herbeigekommen. Wir nehmen Zuflucht zur Behausung deiner Füße. Lass uns (aus dem Hause) hinausgehen [d.h. lass uns Mönche werden], erlöse uns (von dem Leid, lass uns) den Gesetzes-Nektar zuteil (werden)!"

Thereupon the two affiliated kāśyapas, together with [their] students, sallied forth, [and] having come to the Buddha, the teacher, they said: "Oh Mahāśramaṇa! Together with a retinue of these we have come here. We take refuge in the home of your feet. Let us go (out of the house) [i.e. let us become monks], redeem us (from suffering, let us partake) of the nectar of the law."
I will not teach that to you [pl.] now.
I will not teach that to you [pl.] now.
Der in Kunstfertigkeit [und] upāya geschickte Alleswissende, der Herr, führte die Flechtenträger-Gemeinde fort.
The Omniscient, skilled in artistry [and] upāya, the lord, led the community of plait-bearers away.

Es war ein Rājarṣi, Gaya [mit] Namen, sich dort aufhaltend. Nach dessen Namen ist der Hain Gayāśīrṣa [mit]Namen benannt worden. Dort pflegte der Buddha [seinen] Lieblingsaufenthalt zu nehmen. ODER (Thomas 1957): Mit dessen Namen hat er [scil. der Buddha] den Hain Gayāśīrṣa [mit]Namen benannt. Dort pflegte der Buddha [seinen] Lieblingsaufenthalt zu nehmen

A Rājarṣi, Gaya [by] name, was staying there. After his name the grove Gayāśīrṣa was called [by]name. There the Buddha was wont to stay [as his] favourite sojourn. OR (Thomas 1957): ...with his name he [i.e. the Buddha] has called the grove Gayāśīrṣa [by] name. There the Buddha was wont to stay [as his] favourite sojourn.
Die vier Körperbewegungen führte er vor: [wtl. machte er]: Er setzte sich, stellte sich [hin], ging hin und her [und] machte die Gebärde des Liegens.
The four bodily movements he made: he sat [down], stood, went to and fro [and] made the gesture of lying [down].
[because of] that they were worshipers of the fire, given this/with respect to this/because of this he summoned them wishing to proclaim the Law of the family [and] spoke to them.

Nachdem er [scil. der Buddha] diese [scil. die Flechtenträgermönche] durch die Wunder zu Gläubigen bekehrt hatte, rief er sie in dem Wunsch [wtl. wünschend], [ihnen] mit Rücksicht darauf, dass sie eben Feuerverehrer waren, das ebenderselben Familie angehörige Gesetz [d.h. das ihnen gemäße Gesetz] vorzutragen, [und] sprach zu ihnen:

After he [i.e. the Buddha] had converted them [i.e. the monks wearing plaits] into believers with [the help of] miracles, he summoned them, wishing to proclaim [to them], with regard to [the fact that] they were venerators of the fire, the law pertaining to the same family [i.e. the law appropriate to them] [and] spoke to them:
